intro: Aspera nutans, commonly known as the drooping aspera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often drooping stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in spikes at the tips of the branches. Aspera nutans is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and delicate floral display.
